alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ulster County through 400 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Woodland Valley Campground, or 19 miles southwest of Hunter, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Hurley, Woodstock, Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Lake Katrine, Phoenicia, West Hurley, Mount Tremper, Olivebridge, Port Ewen, Veteran, Shandaken, Centerville, Denning, Rolling Meadows, Glenford, Manorville and Oliverea. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central New York.
